metadata.case_name: Jagir Kaur and Anr. v. Jaswant Singh

facts.text: Jagir Kaur, first appellant, married Jaswant Singh, respondent, in 1930.
Jaswant Singh employed in police force in Africa.
Muklawa ceremony took place about 7 years after marriage, when respondent was in Africa.
First appellant taken to mother-in-law's house, lived there few years, then returned to parental house.
Jaswant Singh came to India on 5 months leave, lived with first appellant in house at Hans Kalan, Ludhiana District, for 5 months.
Before leaving for Africa, Jaswant Singh married another wife and took her to Africa.
After 5-6 years, Jaswant Singh came back on leave, took first appellant to Africa.
In Africa, first appellant gave birth to daughter, second appellant.
Disputes arose, respondent sent first appellant back to India, promising maintenance but did not send money.
In 1960, respondent came back to India, purchased property in Ludhiana District for Rs. 25,000/- in name of minor children by second wife.

First appellant filed petition under s.488 CrPC in Court of First Class Magistrate, Ludhiana, on behalf of herself and minor daughter, claiming Rs.200/- per month maintenance, when respondent was in Ludhiana.
Respondent filed counter-affidavit denying allegations, pleaded no jurisdiction as never resided in district or last resided with wife there.
Magistrate held jurisdiction exists as husband and wife last resided together in Ludhiana District, awarded Rs.100/- to wife and Rs.50/- to daughter per month.
Additional Sessions Judge, Ludhiana, dismissed revision, upheld jurisdiction and maintenance.
Punjab High Court set aside orders on jurisdiction, held permanent home in Africa, visits temporary.
Respondent born in Ludhiana District, mother staying in Hans Kalan village there.
Notice served on respondent in Ludhiana, filed counter-affidavit, obtained exemption from personal appearance, then left for Africa.

legal_issues.text: True construction of s.488(8) CrPC: meaning of 'resides', 'is', 'last resided with his wife' for jurisdiction.
Whether Magistrate, Ludhiana had territorial jurisdiction to entertain petition under s.488 CrPC.

petitioner_arguments.text: Respondent last resided with wife in house in village Hans Kalan, Ludhiana District, and was in District when application filed, so Magistrate had jurisdiction.
Respondent submitted to jurisdiction of Magistrate.

respondent_arguments.text: Permanent home in Africa, two visits to Ludhiana temporary, did not reside in district or last reside with wife there.

court_reasoning.text: Rejected plea of submission as not raised below, mixed question of fact and law, no exceptional circumstances.
court_reasoning.key_observation: First appellant did not raise plea in pleadings or lower courts.

court_reasoning.text: s.488(8) CrPC provides three alternative forums: where he resides, is, or last resided with wife; designed for urgent relief to discarded wife/helpless child; words to be liberally construed.
'Resides' means dwell permanently or for considerable time, settled/usual abode; includes temporary residence with animus manendi, not casual/flying visit; depends on context.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Not technical domicile; illustrated with examples.

court_reasoning.text: 'Last resided' same as 'resides', means last temporary residence in India (not extra-territorial).
court_reasoning.key_observation: Code operates in India except J&K; no jurisdiction over foreign courts.

court_reasoning.text: 'Is' means physical presence at time proceedings taken, wider than resides, for casual visits.
court_reasoning.key_observation: To catch deserter on flying visit.

court_reasoning.text: Respondent last resided with wife in Hans Kalan, Ludhiana (5 months stay with intention); also present in district when petition filed.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Temporary residence with animus manendi qualifies.

court_reasoning.text: Concurrent findings on quantum of maintenance by Magistrate and Sessions Judge not to be interfered in revision.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Salary and property considered; Rs.100/- wife, Rs.50/- child.

holdings.text: First Class Magistrate, Ludhiana had jurisdiction under s.488(8) CrPC as respondent last resided with wife there and was present when petition filed.
'Resides' and 'last resided' include temporary residence with animus manendi in India; 'is' means physical presence.

precedents_cited.relevance: 'Resides' implies more than brief visit, not domicile.
Casual or flying visit excluded from 'resides'.
Casual residence for temporary purpose without intention not 'resides'.
'Reside' implies more than stay, some intention to remain.
Test of residence is animus manendi, intention to stay indefinite period.

precedents_cited.case_name: In re Drucker No. 2 Basden, Ex Parte
precedents_cited.relevance: Statute jurisdiction limited to territory, not extra-territorial.

statutes_cited.name: Code of Criminal Procedure
statutes_cited.relevance: Jurisdiction for maintenance proceedings: where resides, is, or last resided with wife.

statutes_cited.name: Code of Criminal Procedure
statutes_cited.relevance: Extent of operation to whole of India except Jammu & Kashmir.

outcome.summary: Appeal allowed; High Court order set aside; Magistrate's order restored granting Rs.100/- per month to wife and Rs.50/- to daughter.
outcome.relief_granted: Maintenance at Rs.100/- per month for first appellant and Rs.50/- per month for second appellant.

key_quotes.text: The crucial words of the sub-section are, resides, is and where he last resided with his wife.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Identifies key terms for jurisdiction interpretation.

key_quotes.text: a person resides in a place if he through choice makes it his abode permanently or even temporarily
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Defines 'resides' including temporary abode with animus manendi.

key_quotes.text: Proceedings under this section may be taken against any person in any district where he is
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Emphasizes physical presence jurisdiction for casual visits.

key_quotes.text: We must hold that he last resided with her in a place within the jurisdiction of the First Class Magistrate, Ludhiana.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Applies law to facts, upholds jurisdiction.
